New Records: Mark Vientos is the first Met to hit multiple homers in a postseason game since Michael Conforto on October 31, 2015, in Game Four of the World Series against the Kansas City Royals.
Castellanos’ single was the fifth walk-off hit in Phillies postseason history.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single with two outs in the bottom of the ninth to give the Phillies a 7-6 win.
Mark Vientos hit two home runs, including a game-tying two-run homer in the ninth inning.
Bryce Harper and Nick Castellanos hit back-to-back home runs in the sixth inning to tie the game.
Bryson Stott hit a two-run triple in the eighth inning to give the Phillies a temporary lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson praised Nick Castellanos for his performance, highlighting his home run to tie the game and the base hit to win it.
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza praised Mark Vientos for his awareness and ability to perform under pressure.
Bryson Stott commented on Nick Castellanos' ability to stay calm and deliver in high-pressure situations.
Rob Thomson reflected on the resilience of both teams, predicting a classic battle in the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies made several key defensive plays, including a leaping grab by Bryson Stott and diving stops by Bryce Harper.

The middle-of-the-order hitters for the Phillies (Turner, Harper, Castellanos, and Stott) combined for significant offensive production, going 8-for-16 with a triple, two homers, six RBI, and three walks.
Luis Severino delivered a Quality Start for the Mets, allowing three runs over six innings with seven strikeouts.
Others: The Mets and Phillies will play Game Three of the series at Citi Field in New York, with Aaron Nola starting for the Phillies and Sean Manaea for the Mets.
